nodes.bodyText: This relies on presence of impliesRequired: true validator now, does not need to assess the validator type anymore.

Renamed from options to attributes for couple of reasons:

most often these are not optional, but rather required for validators to specify
in Java annotations the term attributes is used

Also used interfaces instead of type aliases for consistency, as all of them specify object contents.
Added a flag. The old value referred to validator constrain argument (e. g., minimum value specified in annotation), removed from here to reduce confusion.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -29,7 +29,7 @@ export type ValidationCallback<T> = (value: T) => boolean | ValueError<T> | void
 export interface Validator<T> {
   validate: ValidationCallback<T>,
   message: string,
-  value?: any
+  impliesRequired?: boolean

nodes.bodyText: Not strictly required in runtime, but still specifying this explicitly. This allows for simple asserting false in the tests.
Exposed attribute keys on the validator directly, removing the wrapper object for consistency with other validators.
Minimum greater than zero means required.
